reviews.review_msg: she doesn't even know what she's teaching. does a very poor job of explaining the material.

Lisa doesn't lecture well, nor does she explain key concepts well at all. Rambles and gets off topic a lot. Rude personality and acts condescendingly towards her students. I would absolutely never take a course with her again. Avoid her if you can.
very very good. awesome hair, moist and lustrous. Does not suffer fools gladly. Lazy fools give bad reviews - get off your suff and think!

Her "standards" are said to be "high", but actually they are just obscure and qualitatively different from the rest of the department. Those who get the very highest marks in other classes get the worst ones in hers, and people who are mediocre at best in other classes thrive in Shapiro's classes. I asked around. If you are a simpleton, this is you
Her voice and face could curdle fresh milk, and her comments on papers suggested she is incapable of liking anything any student could ever produce.

Very well informed.  Knows hist and switches easily between historical thinkers ideas.  Has good natured humour and smiles alot.  Talks at the speed of thought, but gives multiple examples (sometimes).  He does not seem very demanding, but will probably see through any lame attempts on papers.  Follow closely or you will be left behind.

Dr. Heide's style of lecturing is highly engaging and he explains most concepts and theories in detail. If you're interested in Early Modern philosophy, I'd highly recommend taking a class with him. 

Don't expect him to respond to your emails, however. He didn't respond to both of my emails, which is puzzling 'cause they were very simple questions

Avoid if you're looking for an online-friendly experience. If there is an opposite of online savvy, this is it. You have to hand in every paper in person & no class updates/readings on Canvas. The material is dense and as easy to parse as 17th-century writing sounds, which makes the lack of slides or audio recordings worse

Dai is really passionate and obviously is well-versed in philosophy, most of the grade is paper based and he doesn't have lecture slides so you actually need to show up to even slightly grasp what's going on. Readings are extremely difficult

Though I think he is a very knowledgable instructor,  his overall demeanor in the classroom came off as conceited. Unclear about expectations and did not give adequate or helpful feedback on essays. The class lacked a sense of welcomed discussion and was not a comfortable atmosphere conducive to learning. Regret taking.
Pretty tough prof, but worth it. Lecture are actually valuable  and you learn a lot.
